## AppBuilder.onKey() method

Register a key handler.

**Signature:**

```typescript
onKey(keys: string | string[], handler: KeyHandler<State, Components>): AppBuilder<State, Components>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

keys


</td><td>

string \| string\[\]


</td><td>

Single key string or array of key strings


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

handler


</td><td>

[KeyHandler](./dsl.keyhandler.md)<!-- -->&lt;State, Components&gt;


</td><td>

Function to call when any of the keys are pressed


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md)<!-- -->&lt;State, Components&gt;

A new [AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md) with the key handler registered

## Remarks

Key handlers receive an [EventContext](./dsl.eventcontext.md) with the current state and components. Multiple keys can be bound to the same handler by passing an array of key strings. Key strings support modifiers like 'ctrl+c', 'alt+enter'.

## Example


```typescript
createApp()
  .onKey('q', ({ quit }) => quit())
  .onKey(['up', 'k'], ({ state, update }) => update({ index: state.index - 1 }))
  .onKey('ctrl+c', ({ quit }) => quit())
```
